repnme.cdata!:
Indonesia - Third Jabotabek Urban
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project was satisfactory, and
            sustainability is likely. However, institutional development
            impact, was only modest, since inter-departmental
            coordination, particularly between central, and local
            governments, as well as with community groups is still weak,
            even though improvements are underway to strengthen
            community participation. Lessons address first, general
            issues for project implementation, such as the need to
            increase women participation in urban neighborhood
            management, to warrant a review in the provision of
            micro-credit within urban areas, and, to provide continuous
            assistance adjustments in urban management. Second, the use
            of funds to lease solid waste collection vehicles, is a
            practical way to increase private sector development, and
            should be evaluated. Similarly, acquisition of laboratory
            equipment, and personnel training in environmental
            protection, and pollution control should include civil
            society, and, drainage management should enforce guidelines
            to improve severe flooding. Third, specific Bank lessons,
            suggest the need for a less prescriptive approach for
            community-based development projects, rather focused on
            implementing objectives, and deeper recognition between
            environment, and health. However, support to
            performance-oriented maintenance management systems, should
            not be supported, until completion of brief analyses on
            previous activities, to establish clear objectives for
            future activities.

729086.trustfund: TF023411-SIDA CTF (POPULAR PARTICIPATION),TF021251-PHRD-JAPANESE CTF (USD ACCOUNT),TF036011-ETHIOPIA - FAMILY HEALTH PROJECT,TF026860-JABOTABEK URBAN DEVELOPMENT III

repnme.cdata!:
Evaluation of the sanitation component of
            the Kampung Improvement Program (KIP) Third Jabotabek Urban
            Development Project (JUDP III)

abstracts.cdata!:
This study aims to analyze the
            sanitation component of the Kampung Improvement Program
            -Third Jabotabek Urban Development Project (KIP - JUDP III)
            for Indonesia. The sanitation program is an important
            component of KIP and has a direct impact on the
            environmental and health conditions of the rural population.
            The objectives of this study are to: 1) evaluate the
            achieved progress and the existing institutions or rural
            organizations which were established to operate and maintain
            the sanitation facilities and environmental improvements; 2)
            identify the weaknesses and successes in building the
            sanitation facilities; 3) design the strategy for project
            implementation in the remaining time period; and (iv)
            prepare a sanitation component framework for the next KIP.
            This document provides a detailed introduction and
            background of the program, key findings, and lessons learned
            from implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
Indonesia - Third Jabotabek Urban
            Development Project (JUDP III)

abstracts.cdata!:
This project is designed to assist
            Government efforts in Jabotabek. Objectives include : i)
            introducing a more effective and sustainable approach to
            provision of basic services through extensive community
            particpation and incorporation of social and economic
            development in recognized low-income urban communities; ii)
            strengthening environmental protection and pollution control
            in the Jakarta region; and iii) improving maintenance of
            existing infrastructure networks.  The project consists of
            the following components : a) the Kampung Improvement
            Program which will provide basic infrastructure and
            community services in low income kampungs throughout
            metropolitan Jakarta; b) priority solid waste management
            including secondary collection of household refuse to the 75
            districts to be upgraded under the project as well as 8
            districts in priority flood-prone areas; c) cleaning up
            informal dump sites and stabilizing three full municipal
            dump sites for closure; d) technical assistance to improve
            resource recovery; d) environmental protection and pollution
            control including : 1) institutional strengthening; 2)
            development of a natural resources inventory; 3) formulation
            of a pollution reduction strategy; 4) feasibility studies in
            industrial joint waste treatment and high polluting
            small-scale industries; and 5) technical assistance to
            update the planning framework for development in the Jakarta region.
